frameDefinitions: The Sleeper stays in an altered state of consciousness with greatly reduced external awareness.
A  Source_symbol in a Source_representation system is presented to be matched by a Target_symbol in a Target_representation in the ability to express a particular Content.
A Protagonist is awake at some Time and Place.
The words in this frame describe a period of time, as opposed to a point in time.
Words in this frame name the different parts of the calendric cycle, both man-made and natural.
A Trajector is identified as occurring at the same time as some better-known Landmark.
frameExamples:
A palintonon or palintone <t>translates</t> as 'V-spring' and euthytonon or euthytone
translates as 'straight-spring' from Greek.
The best <t>time</t> of year for planting tends to be fairly regular.
Jo's mother will visit on this coming <t>Tuesday</t>.
He tried to take care of that <t>on</t> his last visit .
listRoleDefinitions: The entity that is sleeping.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the sleep occurs.
Where the event takes place.
A symbol or set of symbols representing the <fen>Content</fen> in the <fen>Source_representation</fen> format.
The representation system in which the <fen>Content</fen> pre-exists.
A symbol or set of symbols representing the <fen>Content</fen> in the <fen>Target_representation</fen> format.

The representation system within which the <fen>Target_symbol</fen> is equivalent in its signification to the <fen>Source_symbol</fen> within the <fen>Source_representation</fen> system
.
The information that is meant to be represented by the <fen>Source_symbol</fen> and <fen>Target_symbol</fen>.
The period of time during which the translation equivalence holds.
The entity that is not sleeping.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Protagonist</fen> is awake.
Where the event takes place.
A quantity or other characterization of the <fen>State</fen>'s duration.  In this frame, the duration can be inexact.
An ongoing state whose duration can be measured.
<fen>Relative_time</fen> is used for the word or words that locate the time with respect to an identifiable reference point.
<fen>Whole</fen> is used for the larger unit of which the target word names a part.
The calendric unit that is denoted. LUs in this frame all denote the <fen>Unit</fen>.
The entity that occurs at some time.
The event which designates the time at which a trajector occurs.
The period that occurs with respect to some other time.
The period in which a trajector takes place.  This period can be cyclical and, in that case, is interpreted contextually.
The event that occurs at some time.
The entity which designates the time of some trajector.  Note: this role is infrequent or non-existent in English and is included for completeness.
listRoleExamples: <fex>'Hi, dude'</fex> translates into Spanish as Hola tío.

The bands' name translates into English as Killer Bananas <fex>from their native French</fex>
and they play metal and horror themed punk rock 'n' roll.
The word giallo translates into English as <fex>'yellow'</fex>.
More sinister still is the fact that Homeland translates <fex>into German</fex> as Fatherland.
<fex>The disclaimer in question</fex> translated as: 'Yo, Gringo! This episode of The Twilight Zone was paid for by Robinson for Congress.'
<fex>She</fex> was awake through the whole football game.
<fex>He was a great actor</fex> in his time.
Jo's mother will visit <fex> this coming</fex> Tuesday.
Jo fled in the early morning <fex>of  Sunday December 15</fex>.
The current <fex>President of Georgia</fex> was born in Tbilisi.
During <fex>last night's walk</fex> , I stubbed my toe.
Future <fex>eras</fex> will be vastly changed from today.
I went to the store on <fex>Tuesday</fex>.
Currently, <fex>researchers are making new discoveries very quickly.</fex>

sourceCandidateSpans.text: The Supreme Court of the territory
